titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Andover Newton Theological School Records
titlestmt.author: Andover Newton Theological School library staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday August 15, 2018 at 17:33

did.abstract: These are the official archives of Andover Newton Theological School.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into thirteen series: I. Boards of Trustees, II. Presidents, III. Deans, IV. Faculty, V. Students, VI. Alumni, VII. Departments and Offices, VIII. History, IX. Audiovisual, X. Publications, XI. Realia, XII. Vertical Files, XIII. Related Organizations.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: As the oldest graduate school of theology in the United States, Andover Newton traces its roots to the early 1800s and the desire to prepare a well-educated clergy among both Congregationalist and Baptists. With the 1778 founding of Phillips Academy in Andover, Massachusetts, and the establishment of a separate department of divinity in 1807, the Andover Theological Seminary was created. Instruction at the southern Merrimack River Valley campus continued until 1907, when the trustees agreed to move the school to the urban setting of Cambridge, Massachusetts, to broaden the curriculum and establish closer ties with the academic world. In 1908, plans for a formal affiliation with Harvard Divinity School were started, but merger attempts resulted in a legal struggle over adherence to Andover's founding principles.

The move to Cambridge left the school with a dwindling enrollment (four graduate students, four seniors, two middlers, four juniors, and four special students) and a depleted faculty of three professors. In 1931, at the invitation of the Newton Theological Institution, Andover relocated to Newton Centre. During the mid-twentieth century, the student body became more diverse as African-American students attended in significant numbers and the enrollment of women increased. In 1965, the two schools formally merged, forming the Andover Newton Theological School. Among its many accomplishments, the school pioneered the "teaching parish" approach to field education and was one of the first schools in the country to offer Doctor of Ministry degrees.

While maintaining a campus in Newton through 2018 and granting degrees through 2019, Andover Newton formally affiliated with Yale Divinity School in 2017 and established a presence in New Haven as Andover Newton Seminary at Yale Divinity School.

chronlist.head: Chronology of Andover Newton Theological School

chronitem.event: Andover Theological Seminary created in Andover, Massachusetts.
Andover relocates to Cambridge, Massachusetts and establishes ties with Harvard University.

Andover Trustees and the President and Fellows of Harvard University adopt a "Plan of Closer Affiliation," forming a non-denominational theological school; immediately after adopting the Plan, the Andover Board of Visitors declares it void.

Supreme Judicial Court of the Commonwealth renders a decision to suspend the "Plan," citing the language of the Andover Constitution and Associate Statutes. The Seminary completes the academic year under the 1908 agreement. Andover Trustees and Harvard repeal the decision, the faculty resigns, and the Andover Trustees vote to suspend instruction.
Andover Trustees appoint a committee to explore the possibility of an affiliation with the Newton Theological Institution and by 1930 draft a document entitled, "Articles of Affiliation."

Andover Trustees, joined by the Board of Visitors, file a bill before the Court, stating it is impossible to fulfill in all respects the restrictive designs of the founders. By conforming to the creedal requirements, it would not be possible to accomplish the primary object of the foundersâ€”providing educated ministers for Trinitarian Congregational churches. The bill asks the Court to judge that persons whose theological views conformed with Trinitarian Congregationalists generally should be deemed qualified to serve as professors in the Seminary; the court enters a decree to that effect.
Andover relocates to Newton Center, Massachusetts at the invitation of Newton Theological Institutution.
Andover Theological Seminary and Newton Theological Institution formally merge to form the Andover Newton Theological School.

While maintaining a campus in Newton through 2018 and granting degrees through 2019, Andover Newton formally affiliated with Yale Divinity School in 2017 and established a presence in New Haven as Andover Newton Seminary at Yale Divinity School.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records have been maintained in the order in which they were received from Andover Newton Theological School. Included in the records are correspondence and memos; financial records; legal documents; minutes; reports; statistical data; subject files; course catalogs, directories, and handbooks; transcripts; vertical files; audiovisual material; photographic and digital images; publications; clippings; realia; artwork; maps, site plans, and property records; announcements, brochures, fliers, and pamphlets; biographical information; donor files; membership records; audits; necrologies; syllabi; questionnaires and surveys; committee and conference files; speeches; working papers; histories; manuals, policies, and procedures; constitutions and by-laws; program files; anniversary material; and related material reflecting the daily work and activities of the school's trustees; presidents; deans; faculty; students; alumni; department and offices; and affiliated organizations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes minutes, reports, proposals, presentation, audits, correspondence, leases, financial agreements, by-laws, voting records, disclosures, policies, directories, committee records, budgets, clippings, and program evaluation of the general Board of Trustees, Executive Board of Trustees, and related Trustees committees including Administrative; Budget and Investment; Buildings and Grounds; Educational Affairs; Finance; Informational Systems Liaison; Joint Finance; New Building; Long-Range Planning; Management; Nominating; Purpose and Planning; Salary and Personnel. Also included are records of task forces and accreditation files. There is also an accompanying inventory for some of the minute files, which is found in box 02.

did.unittitle: Minutes and supporting documents: Nominating Committee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes internal and external correspondence; reports; committee and task force files; school policies; legal contracts; property records; statistical data; proposal plans for programs, projects, and campus space needs; financial records; retirement, salary, and tenure policies; program planning files; administrative, departmental, and committee meeting minutes; court case files; clippings; questionnaires and surveys; speaking engagements; and general subject files. Also includes subject files kept by two President's Assistants. There is also an accompanying inventory for some of the presidents, which is found in box 13.

did.unittitle: George H. Sinclair, Jr. (interim) subject files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Description (33 cubic ft.; 33 cartons): The series includes program agreements with other institutions; award files and lists; committee records; conference files; correspondence; faculty chair files; department and program budgets; academic courses and campus event files; Dean's Team files; department and committee meeting minutes; fellowship, grants, and scholarship funds; academic standing and other student files; department and program policies; faculty search committee files; department records; syllabi; biographical information; clippings; articles; annual reports; and subject files. Also includes Vision 2007 files. There is also an accompanying inventory for some of the dean files, which is found in box 29.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes correspondence; meeting minutes; announcements; agendas; planning material and working papers for retreats and workshops; faculty manuals; and committee assignments files for the faculty.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains student integrative papers for possible theses development; student class papers; student newspapers and newsletters; and records of the Student Association, which include the organization's constitution and by-laws, minutes, budgets, speeches, letters, treasurer's reports, annual reports, fliers and announcements, a missionary scrapbook, and a student cookbook.

Andover-Newton Theological School Men's Fellowship and Support Group 2004 Cookbook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains the records of the Andover Newton Alumni Association and the Association of the Andover Newton Graduates and includes minutes, annual reports, budges, letters, fliers and announcements, memos, and banquet programs.

did.unittitle: Lists of missionaries and Asian alumni

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes the records of academic and administrative departments and offices.

did.unittitle: Blue prints and site plans: campus
Committee files: Institute for Supervised Ministry
Dissertation re: history of Field Education
Director's files: O'neal, Ellis E., Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains addresses, correspondence, planning material, and programs for the 175th anniversary; school background information and histories, clippings, statistical information, and campus maps; a Japanese edict against Christianity; and a collection of citations and awards presented to the school.

did.unittitle: Correspondence re: Gordon College of Theology (Herrick)
Edict: Japanese government opposition to Christianity

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is divided into two subseries. The Arts and Maps subseries contains maps of Newton, Massachusetts; a campus poster of Colby Hall; paintings and rubbings with Asian themes; prints with images of Asian themes, Andover Newton campus buildings, the English alphabet, and block prints produced by the American Engraving Company; a Japanese scroll; and site plans for a Salem Street house in Boston, Massachusetts. The Photographs subseries contains photographs, negatives, slides, digital photographs on floppy disks, and photograph albums, which include photographic images of people; events; buildings and grounds; and organizations. There are also disposable cameras with undeveloped rolls of film, which contain photographs of Community Day celebrations.

did.unittitle: Prints: Images of ANTS buildings (Lapham/Miller Assoc.)
Prints: Print block images (American Engraving Company)
Prints: Vedic Deities and Japanese images
Site plans: House on Salem Street (Boston, Mass.)
Photographs, negatives, slides, and photographs on floppy disks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes Presidential annual reports; booklets; clippings; programs, invitations, and speeches for baccalaureate, commencement, convocation, and Presidential inaugurations; course catalogs; administrative, alumni, faculty, and student directories; student handbooks; published journals; administrative, faculty, staff, and departmental newsletters; study guides; publicity fliers, brochures, pamphlets, bulletins, programs, and announcements for conferences, events, workshops, recruitment, and lectures; and books published by or about the school. Also includes unpublished course related manuscripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes school promotional and anniversary realia and memorabilia and object acquired from missionary travels around the world.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes articles; biographical sketches; clippings; correspondence; invitations; reports; press releases; publication lists; course listings; program bulletins; photographs; fliers, brochures, and announcements; presentation papers; membership lists; and material relating to installations and memorials of faculty and trustees. Also includes topic files for Alumni; Associations; Buildings and Grounds; Campus Activities; Clippings; Commemorations; Convocation; Council; Deans; Development; History; Lectureships; Library; Pictorial; Presidents; Professorships; Special Programs; Special Reports; Students; and Trustees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes annual reports; budgets and financial records; account books; committee minutes and general committee files; newsletters and other publications; press releases; bulletins; articles of incorporation and by-laws; project proposals; fundraising files; legal files; correspondence; conference questionnaires; speeches; workshop files; publicity fliers, brochures, and announcements; speaker biographies; memos; meeting agendas; reports; program files; resource and working files; subject files; and conference registration lists for organizations related to the Andover Newton Theological School.
